_header: Wot though I be put far out of conceit and sight [Watt thou I be putt fer ought of conceyte and syght]
Note:
Letter 682 in the Paston Letters (Davis (2004)
XDavis, Norman. Paston Letters and Papers of the Fifteenth Century.
EETS s.s. 20 and 21 (2004).
Title(s): I have you all in remembrance both day and nyght
_description: ‘I have you all in remembrance both day and nyght’, by Henry Berry, A.D. 1464 — one long couplet

BLAdd43489.Transcription:
watt thou I be putt for ought of conceyte & syghtI haue you all
                    in remembraunce both day & nyght
